intro: Perityle cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf perityle, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Perityle cordifolia is often found in damp, forested areas and is adapted to the cool, moist climate of its native habitat. Its unique heart-shaped leaves and delicate appearance make it a distinctive species within its ecological community.
